info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Berkshire and eastern Columbia Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Philmont, or 9 miles west of Great Barrington, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Great Barrington, Lee, Lenox, Copake, New Lebanon, Austerlitz, Ancram, Philmont, Housatonic, Stockbridge, Hillsdale, Canaan, Richmond, Taghkanic, West Stockbridge, Washington, Alford, Barkerville and Pachin Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
